content: पिंगल {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [पिंग-सिध्मा° लच्, पिंगं लाति, ला-क वा <ls>Tv.</ls>] Reddish-brown, yellowish, brown, tawny; <ls>R. 12. 71</ls>; <ls>Ms. 3. 8.</ls> --लः {@--1@} The tawny colour. {@--2@} Fire. {@--3@} A monkey. {@--4@} An ichneumon. {@--5@} A small owl. {@--6@} A kind of snake. {@--7@} <ab>N.</ab> of an attendant on the sun. {@--8@} <ab>N.</ab> of one of Kubera's treasures. {@--9@} <ab>N.</ab> of a reputed sage, the father of Sanskrit prosody, his work being known as पिगलच्छंदःशास्त्र; छंदोज्ञानानंधिं जघान मकरो वेलातटे पिंगलं <ls>Pt. 2. 33.</ls> --लं {@--1@} Brass. {@--2@} Yellow orpiment. --ला {@--1@} A kind of owl. {@--2@} The Śiśu tree (शिंशपा). {@--3@} A kind of metal. {@--4@} A particular vessel of the body. {@--5@} The female elephant of the south {@--6@} <ab>N.</ab> of a courtezan who became remarkable for her piety and virtuous life; (the Bhāgavata mentions how she and Ajamīḍha were delivered from the trammels of the world).
